sections.title: Getting Started with LND Boilerplate
sections.subtitle: Quick Start Guide
sections.description: Get up and running with LND Boilerplate in minutes. This guide will walk you through the installation, setup, and your first steps.

sections.title: Prerequisites
sections.content:
Before you begin, make sure you have the following installed on your system:

  • Node.js 18.0 or later
  • npm 9.0 or later (or yarn 1.22 or later)
  • Git for version control
  • A modern code editor (VS Code recommended)

sections.title: Installation Options
sections.subtitle: Choose the method that works best for you

sections.title: Quick Start Installation
sections.content:
For the fastest setup, use our create command:

npx create-lnd-app@latest my-project
cd my-project
npm run dev

This will create a new project with all the necessary dependencies and configurations already set up.

sections.title: Manual Installation
sections.content:
If you prefer manual setup or want to customize the installation:

  1. Clone the repository:
    git clone https://github.com/lnd-boilerplate/lnd-boilerplate.git
  2. Install dependencies:
    npm install
  3. Set up environment:
    cp .env.example .env.local
  4. Start development server:
    npm run dev

sections.title: Project Structure
sections.content:
After installation, your project will have this structure:

my-project/
├── apps/                 # Application packages
│   ├── landing/         # Landing page app
│   └── docs/            # Documentation app
├── packages/            # Shared packages
│   ├── ui/             # UI component library
│   ├── config/         # Configuration utilities
│   └── types/          # TypeScript type definitions
├── docs/               # Project documentation
├── package.json        # Root package.json
└── README.md           # Project overview

items.question: What if I get an error during installation?
items.answer: Check that you have the correct Node.js version installed. If you continue to have issues, try clearing your npm cache with 'npm cache clean --force' and then reinstall.

items.question: Can I use Yarn instead of npm?
items.answer: Yes! LND Boilerplate works with both npm and Yarn. Simply replace 'npm' commands with 'yarn' equivalents in the installation and usage instructions.

items.question: How do I customize the default configuration?
items.answer: You can modify the configuration files in the 'packages/config' directory. The main configuration file is 'site.config.json' where you can customize layouts, design systems, and component settings.

items.question: What's the difference between the quick start and manual setup?
items.answer: Quick start uses our create command which automatically sets up everything for you. Manual setup gives you full control over each step and is better for learning or customizing the installation process.
